remarks: Part of a study of the Axiom of Replacement used by the Isabelle prover.  The object PrimReplace is apparently the image of the function encoded by ` ph ( x , y ) ` i.e. the class ` ( { <. x , y >. | ph } " A ) ` .  If so, we can prove Isabelle's "Axiom of Replacement" conclusion without using the Axiom of Replacement, for which I (N. Megill) currently have no explanation. (Contributed by NM, 26-Oct-2006.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 4-Dec-2016.)
statement:
isarep1 $p |- ( b e. ( { <. x , y >. | ph } " A ) <-> E. x e. A [ b / y ] ph ) $.
$d A x $.
$d b x y $.
